decks.notes: The deck focuses on controlling the game by disrupting the opponent's plays with counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, while also utilizing removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Prismatic Ending. The inclusion of cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Back to Basics helps to generate card advantage and restrict the opponent's options. Additional cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provide card selection and utility, while creatures like Gilded Drake and Hullbreacher offer additional disruption. The mana base is designed to support the deck's focus on control and consistency.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then reanimate them onto the battlefield using spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The deck includes a mix of disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo while also utilizing powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Murktide Regent to close out the game quickly. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements while also potentially disrupting the opponent with cards like Wasteland.

The main idea of this deck is to use the combo of Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to mill through the deck and put Narcomoeba and Thassa's Oracle into play to win the game. The deck also includes various control elements such as counterspells like Force of Will and removal like Swords to Plowshares to protect the combo. The deck utilizes Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and other card draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to help find the combo pieces quickly. The land base includes Urza's Saga to search for key artifacts and lands like Cavern of Souls to protect against counterspells.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bring them back onto the battlefield to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also features disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo and control the game. By utilizing a combination of card draw, countermagic, and graveyard recursion, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combos and outvalue the opponent in Legacy 1 vs 1 matchups.

The deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent by leveraging strong creatures and disruptive spells. It aims to accelerate its game plan with cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Crop Rotation to quickly put threats on the board. The inclusion of cards like Thoughtseize and Collector Ouphe allows for disruption of the opponent's game plan. The deck also has a combo finish with Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage, providing an alternate win condition. Overall, the deck combines aggression, disruption, and a combo finish to outpace and outmaneuver opponents.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed to cast Doomsday and win the game with Thassa's Oracle. The deck focuses on setting up a fast and efficient win condition through the use of cards like Brainstorm, Personal Tutor, and Doomsday itself. It utilizes various cantrips and mana accelerants to ensure a smooth and consistent combo execution, while also including disruptive elements like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo from opposing interference. The deck's success relies heavily on precise sequencing and decision-making to achieve victory.

The key concept of this deck is to assemble the Nomad en-Kor and Delighted Halfling combo with Nadu, Winged Wisdom as the win condition. The deck aims to control the game with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Force of Will, while using cards like Brainstorm and Green Sun's Zenith to find key pieces of the combo. The deck also includes interaction and disruption with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Prismatic Ending. Overall, the strategy revolves around assembling the combo and protecting it to secure the win.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bringing them back into play for an explosive combo. It also includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with large threats like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Archon of Cruelty, while also having control elements like Brazen Borrower and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The manabase is optimized for consistency and includes utility lands like Wasteland.

This control deck focuses on utilizing a variety of spells and creatures to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It combines powerful counter spells like Force of Will and Force of Negation with efficient removal like Swords to Plowshares. The deck also includes card draw and manipulation with Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistency. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding provide additional control elements, while powerful creatures like Scion of Draco and Minsc & Boo can quickly close out the game. Overall, this deck aims to control the game through disruption and efficient card advantage.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly using Cloudpost and other lands to bring out powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Emrakul and Ulamog. The deck also includes cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms to control the board and disrupt opponents' strategies. With the ability to search for key artifacts and disrupt opponents' graveyards, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a quick mana advantage and devastating threats, ultimately overwhelming them with sheer power and versatility.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on utilizing a combination of disruption spells and powerful creatures to control the game. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Thundertrap Trainer provide card advantage and allow for more options during the game. Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Snapcaster Mage act as versatile threats while cards like Fatal Push and Force of Will help disrupt the opponent's strategies. The deck also includes a mix of removal spells like Flame of Anor and Kolaghan's Command to deal with opposing threats. Wasteland and Thoughtseize are used to disrupt the opponent's mana base and hand, giving the player the upper hand in the game.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize artifacts such as Mystic Forge, Voltaic Key, and Candelabra of Tawnos to generate infinite mana and card advantage. This allows the player to rapidly assemble a powerful board state with Ugin, Tezzeret, and Karn while utilizing control elements like Trinisphere and Pithing Needle to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also incorporates powerful utility lands like Urza's Saga and Planar Nexus to further support its combo strategy and ensure a strong late-game presence.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana through various fast mana sources and rituals, then using tutors like Infernal Tutor and Burning Wish to find and play powerful combo cards like Ad Nauseam and Tendrils of Agony to win the game in a single turn. The deck also utilizes disruptive elements like Duress and Thoughtseize to protect its combo pieces and disrupt opponent's strategy. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and execute a lethal storm turn to overwhelm the opponent before they can react effectively.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on aggressive tempo plays with cards like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Daze and Force of Will, while also providing card advantage through cards like Brainstorm and Mishra's Bauble. Lightning Bolt provides solid removal and reach, while Wasteland helps to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The deck seeks to apply early pressure and close out the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly play aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent, while controlling the opponent's board with countermagic like Daze and Force of Will. The deck also includes efficient card draw and filtering spells like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain to keep the pressure on. The land base is optimized for consistent mana production and disruption with cards like Wasteland. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm and outpace the opponent with a combination of fast threats and disruptive spells.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly establish board control and disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of efficient removal, counterspells, and card advantage engines. The deck aims to apply pressure with a mix of aggressive creatures, while also utilizing disruptive elements such as Containment Priest and Quantum Riddler to keep the opponent off balance. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Tamiyo and Phelia adds another layer of versatility and card advantage to help maintain control of the game. Additionally, the mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive tempo while also providing utility with cards like Wasteland and fetch lands.
